sub_title: Business consulting I cross-border trade&investment I foreign businesses in tapping into China I Business matchmaking
summary:
Years of proven track records of consultative and client-facing projects in both private consultancy and public sector in China; 

Specialised in facilitating foreign businesses of all-size in tapping into the Chinese market and doing business in China; Managed and conducted projects included China path finding, market entry strategy, the set-up of China presences, channel partner identifying, international trade shows and exhibitions and in-market visits, etc.

company.name: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in China

profile_positions.company: Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in China
profile_positions.description:
I  was accountable for assisting in conducting preliminary market intelligent research for Dutch business that were interested in accessing Chinese market, regulatory inquiry with Chinese government authorities, bilateral Memorandum of Understanding ("MoU") coordination and negotiation, B2B business match making, and network management in trade show and exhibition , etc.

Success included redesigned investigation projects, which increased efficiency and accuracy by 60%; and built up a network of Dutch business in China.
profile_positions.title: The Agriculture and Immigration Departments

profile_positions.description:
Being part of the UK’s national business network promoting trade and investment with China, our organisation (http://www.cbbc.org) was focused on helping British SMEs in accessing Chinese market.

My role as a (senior) project manager has dual functions, business consulting and business development. Specifically, I provided tailored market entry research service to British SMEs and as part of the package, I also, on behalf of the British companies, approached to the potential business partners in China, made initial introduction of the service, products and other collaboration proposal, etc, aiming to achieve business meetings, identify market initiatives and opportunities. Beside, I was also involved in organising in-market activities; seminars, business visits etc and managing British chamber of commerce finance forum member relation.

The 2.5 years was a fantastic experience, everyday working in the very frontline of cross-border business expansion. It was so exciting!  I had chance to talk with both the most innovative and adventurous British entrepreneurs and the conservatives ones, understanding what attracted them to explore China and what were they concerns. Being part of their explorative journey in China, I also learnt so much about my own country and people. For instance, how deeply the engineers in state-own-enterprise were concerned about sustainability and how open they were when it was about new energy and new technology that could help reduce pollution and improve life quality.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Our team was a special task force focusing on China-pathing finding and Company Secretary for foreign investors, namely cross-border investment strategies (vehicle) consulting, location and feasibility study, incorporation and foreign company de-registration (divestment), etc.

I was accountable for developing and executing projects including investment vehicle study and selection, location and feasibility study, incorporation, annual inspection and de-registration, etc., and led a team based in Beijing and across China. 

Success included 1) Orchestrated a team of 12 located in 4 offices for a company secretarial project of a Fortune 500 operating its 20 subsidiaries in 7 cities in China; 2) Spearheaded the team’s first case for the setup of a foreign manufacture factory in China, which built up the team’s capabilities in serving this area and added case credential that led to potential customers and extended our lines of service.
profile_positions.title: Senior Associate - China Business Advisory Service

company.name: Deloitte Consulting (Shanghai) Co., Ltd. Suzhou Branch

profile_positions.description:
I was accountable for implementing corporate tax filing and divestment projects for foreign companies in China, including preparing tax returns, de-registration application documents and letters. I worked closely with (internal) in-charge Senior, Managers and (external) tax authorities and clients.

Success included identified/ fixed an error in the tax deregistration of a Rep Office (a crucial part to the success of divestment), leading to the mitigation of a $28k corporate tax risk.
profile_positions.title: Associate - China Business Advisory Service

company.name: PwC Mainland China and Hong Kong

volunteer_experiences.description:
RSVP, the Rural School Volunteer Programme, was one of the very first and leading PwC Mainland China and Hongkong CSR initiatives; 

I was proud to be one of the pioneers. Because I personally was fully connected to the mission of this programme, which was to share new ideas and inspire students in rural areas to learn more. 

During the one week programme, I achieved my two missions: 1) as a live case of a self Made person who was born and raised up in a rural area and eventually changed her life course; if I could so this, so could the other kids, and 2) was able to connect with one of the brightest kids out there and leave him a simple entertainment device in life, a melodica that I had bought it for the trip.  I wished it would help him overcome difficulties in life while breaking through the world he was born with and enjoy the beauty in life. 

Ref: https://www.pwchk.com/en/corporate-responsibility/cr-report2011-summary.pdf

As part of the social work, I helped a 13 years old teenager on English during summer holiday. The main objective were to deploy my knowledge while helping teenager overcome the barriers in leaning English.
